abstract: Irina Bokova, director general of United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization, condemns destruction of 2,500-year-old cultural heritage site in Sana, Yemen, which was rocked by explosion from unspecified source, as well as deaths caused; witnesses and news reports say explosion was caused by bomb or missile from Saudi plane, which Saudi military denies.
lead_paragraph: The top cultural protection official at the United Nations condemned the damage of “one of the world’s oldest jewels of Islamic urban landscape.”

headline.main: Explosion Destroys Ancient Cultural Heritage Site in Yemen Capital
headline.print_headline: Explosion Destroys an Ancient Cultural Site in Yemeni Capital

snippet: The top cultural protection official at the United Nations condemned the damage of “one of the world’s oldest jewels of Islamic urban landscape.”

keywords.value: United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization
keywords.name: organizations
